intro: Lasthenia glabrata, commonly known as the sticky yellowweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a flat-topped arrangement. Its leaves are usually hairy and somewhat succulent, adapted to survive in dry, rocky environments. Lasthenia glabrata is often found in coastal scrub and grassland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
